Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class RawNoise.Serializer

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.RawNoise.Serializer
Enclosing class:
RawNoise
public static final class RawNoise.Serializer extends Object
Allows serializing RawNoise objects with serialize(RawNoise) and deserializing them with deserialize(String). This requires an instance of the class to be serialized or deserialized to be registered using register(RawNoise) (typically once, though registering multiple times isn't a problem). This is a purely-static utility class.

  • Method Details

    • register

      public static void register(RawNoise random)
      Given a (typically freshly-constructed and never-reused) RawNoise, this registers that instance by its RawNoise.getTag() in a Map, so that this type of RawNoise can be deserialized correctly by deserialize(String). The RawNoise type must implement RawNoise.getTag(), RawNoise.stringSerialize(), RawNoise.stringDeserialize(String), and RawNoise.copy().
      Parameters:
      random - a (typically freshly-constructed) RawNoise that should never be reused elsewhere

    • get

      public static RawNoise get(String tag)
      Gets a copy of the RawNoise registered with the given tag, or null if this has nothing registered for the given tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - a non-null String that could be used as a tag for an RawNoise registered with this class
      Returns:
      a new copy of the corresponding RawNoise, or null if none was found

    • serialize

      public static String serialize(RawNoise noise)
      Given an RawNoise that implements RawNoise.stringSerialize() and RawNoise.getTag(), this produces a serialized String that stores the exact state of the RawNoise. This serialized String can be read back in by deserialize(String).
      Parameters:
      noise - an RawNoise that implements RawNoise.stringSerialize() and RawNoise.getTag()
      Returns:
      a String that can be read back in by deserialize(String)

    • deserialize

      public static RawNoise deserialize(String data)
      Given a String produced by calling serialize(RawNoise) on any registered implementation (as with register(RawNoise)), this reads in the deserialized data and returns a new RawNoise of the appropriate type. This relies on the tag of the type being registered at deserialization time, though it doesn't actually need to be registered at serialization time. This cannot read back the direct output of RawNoise.stringSerialize(); it needs the tag prepended by serialize(RawNoise) to work.
      Parameters:
      data - serialized String data probably produced by serialize(RawNoise)
      Returns:
      a new RawNoise with the appropriate type internally, using the state from data

    • getAll

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<RawNoise> getAll()
      Creates and returns a libGDX Array filled with copies of the RawNoise instances this has registered. The Array will not contain any null items, nor will it contain the ContinuousNoise wrapper.
      Returns:
      a new Array containing each RawNoise instance this has registered, copied
